item.title: LEGO Set 10332: Medieval Town Square
item.description: My early Christmas present to myself for 2024. I opened this early because I want to have the time to build it while I'm off from work. A little LEGO building time each day in addition to walking, cooking, movies, and reading sounds like just the thing. This set should make a nice accompaniment to set 10305: Lion Knight's Castle.

item.title: Frische Austern
item.description:
Fresh Oysters

Tonight a local cafe had fresh oysters. This might be a once-a-year event in sleepy Unterägeri, Switzerland. I partook.

item.title: Aluminum Xmas Tree
item.description:
Last Saturday we mounted our vintage 1950's Evergleam aluminum Christmas tree. Two years ago we upgraded to Hue smart string lights, but last January when we were taking down the tree, I decided to co-opt the string lights to provide mood lighting for my office (the Hue string lights are far too expensive to use only one month a year). Come December I was reluctant to part with my office mood lighting, so I ordered another set of string lights. Let's see if the process repeats itself next January.

I couldn't decide which color photo I liked better, so I decided to post both.

item.title: Umbrella
item.description:
Yesterday was a rainy day, so naturally when I went out in the morning for coffee and errands, I brought my umbrella. However, when I emerged from my favorite coffee shop, my umbrella was missing from the stand out front where I had left it. There was a similar umbrella in a slightly different color, so I hoped that someone had merely taken my umbrella by accident. I don't want the village I live in to be the kind of place where I have to worry about people stealing my shit.

This morning when I went out for coffee, my umbrella had been returned. Faith in humanity reaffirmed (or at least faith in my fellow residents of this mid-sized Swiss village).

item.title: Morning Walk with Chains
item.description: Returned to Raten today for a shorter walk just wearing chains instead of snowshoes: 3.15km, 96m ascent, 0h:47m, 8°C ☀️. Bus service comes every 30 minutes, so I wanted to keep the walk to under an hour. The return bus conveniently drops me off in front of a coffeeshop and the grocery store, so I was able to fuel up with coffee and do some pre-Thanksgiving grocery shopping.

item.title: First Snowshoe Hike of the Season
item.description:
The snowfall was two days ago and it was quite warm today, but the snow was still in decent condition and the terrain pretty.

Raten to Bellevue (and back): 4.97 km, 144 m ascent, 1h:22m, 7°C ⛅️

... and there was actually a view from Bellevue today (towards Lake Zürich).

item.title: Morning Walk with Snow
item.description: We had a relatively big snowfall last night. I wanted to go showshoe up at Raten Pass, but the bus service up there was canceled due to heavy snowfall. I settled for walking the usual farm fields in the valley instead. Maybe tomorrow I can showshoe.

item.title: Morning Walk
item.description: Lovely crisp -3°C morning in the Ägeri valley. More snow arrives this afternoon.

item.title: Testing Mastodon Author Tags
item.description:
... by writing a short post about testing Mastodon author tags. It's all very meta. Quite literally because you add a meta tag with the fediverse:creator property to your HTML document's head.

(Hat tip to David Chartier for pointing me to Robb Knight's instructions.)

item.title: First Snow of Fall
item.description: I was only expecting rain this morning, not a wintry mix that turned into light snow. Tomorrow afternoon we have a level 3 (of 5) heavy snowfall warning. I need to get the winter tires put on the car.
